properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 2 at 11:52PM EST until January 4 at 10:36PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia...

Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton
Counties

Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Big Creek near Alpharetta.
* Until Saturday evening.
* At 1145 PM Thursday the stage was 7.2 feet and slowly rising.
* Minor flooding is occurring, and minor flooding is forecast to
continue.
* Flood stage is 7 feet.
* The river will continue rising, reaching near 8.4 feet Friday
morning. The river will fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon.
* At 8 feet, minor flooding continues to expand further into the
woodlands and fields along the creek from near Cumming in south
Forsyth County to Alpharetta and Roswell in north Fulton County.
Additional portions of The Big Creek Greenway have minor flooding
with 1 to 2 feet of water. Most of the walking and biking paths
will be closed, especially upstream and downstream from the gage
on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park and portions of the
YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be flooded.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until Saturday evening
